runs.comm: Kamran goes over cover first ball! It was a back of a length delivery but Kamran just slashed through the line to lift the ball over the infield. Not the best timing, but it lands safely and they've run three
classically square-driven by Shahzaib! Just a checked drive with a high left elbow and the ball races away through cover point
shy at the stumps! The throw misses but Kamran was home anyway. The ball was tapped to short fine leg and they set off, sharp single
cracking pull out to deep square leg where Craig Kieswetter - who is not keeping wicket today - does really well to chase the ball down, slide and stop it
nudged down to short third man, still just a touch short of a good length from Sidebottom
a touch fuller, but still not full enough to get the ball swinging. Nice and straight though, and Kamran can only push the ball to backward point

Kamran goes early, Bresnan strikes! An ugly swipe across the line from Kamran, trying to slog a pull to a ball that just wasn't short enough for the shot and his nightmare summer with the bat continues
and he's off straight away, staying deep in the crease and waiting on a back of a length delivery, running it off the face down to third man
tickled down the leg side, but short fine leg charges round to stop the single
Bresnan pushes this one slightly wider and holds the ball across the seam, getting it to move away off the pitch slightly and beat the outside edge of Shahzaib's slash
edged again, but it's a thick edge and goes well wide of the slip and down to third man
full, fast and straight from Broad, but hardly any movement through the air or off the pitch and he's easily tapped into the leg side for one
dug in a touch shorter by Broad, decent bounce but it's not quite the bouncer. Yousuf hops into defence
short again from Broad, Yousuf pushes his weight back and pulls in the air to midwicket. He's not middled that at all, though, the ball rushed on to him and struck high on the  bat
dug in again, this time Yousuf tries to guide the ball to third man but a diving Swann at third slip cuts it off
sliced over backward point! Yousuf is known for his elegance with the bat but this was a bit of a hack and he's lucky to get away with it

searingly quick bouncer from Broad, but it's a touch predictable and Yousuf is back in his crease and waiting for it. Again, though, he doesn't quite time the shot and chips the ball just over midwicket
chopped down towards gully, and there's no single on offer there
Yousuf comes down the track and lofts down the ground ... but that's got much more height than distance and the ball plugs in the outfield when it lands
Shahzaib tries to go over cover, but a thick edge takes the ball down to third man

shot! Great innovation from Yousuf, he walked across to the off side but didn't go too far and, importantly, kept his eye on the ball to paddle-pull it past the man at short fine leg. First one he's hit out the middle
slower ball from Bresnan, offcutter, but wily old Yousuf spots it early and just guides the ball behind square
shorter and quicker from Bresnan, Shahzaib tries to repeat Yousuf's shot but he's beaten once again by a touch of extra bounce
banged in by Broad, Yousuf looks for the single to third man but can't beat gully

another good shot from Yousuf, and this one wouldn't have been out of place in a Test match! It was a cutter from Broad, but he slipped in to Yousuf's pads and was eased away past a diving Ryan Sidebottom at short fine leg

he didn't know all that much about that one! A short, fast bouncer from Broad that rushes on to Yousuf. He tried to uppercut it but it just followed him, taking a thick top edge to evade a leaping Davies behind the stumps. Broad has a word, Yousuf has a word back
chipped to long-off, again Yousuf got right underneath this one, the ball lands in the outfield and just stops
nudged into the leg side
pace and bounce from Broad, the leaps rises off a length and takes the shoulder of Shahzaib's bat, bouncing away to third man

Yousuf charges down the track and almost yorks himself in the process! He jams the bat down in time though, calling Shahzaib through for a very sharp single as Bresnan fires in a throw in his follow through
flat-footed, wafty drive from Shahzaib, and he's beaten on the outside edge!
this one slips under the bat! It was a yorker from Bresnan, but well wide of off
Bresnan is giving Shahzaib a good working over here! This time he goes short - Shahzaib had pushed onto the front foot, expecting a full ball - and whistles one past the batsman's grille
this time he was expecting the short ball, and hammers a pull away to long leg! First boundary for Shahzaib
Shahzaib walks across to the off side, trying to flick the ball past Sidebottom at short fine leg, but the fielder pulls off a good, diving stop to keep them to just one
a touch of turn straight away, it's slightly short though and Shahzaib works easily into the leg side
quicker, straighter one from Swann and Shahzaib is slightly squared up as he tries to work it away
desperate swish from Shahzaib, and the ball drops safely between two fielders!
attempted reverse-sweep from Yousuf, but Swann held this one back and the ball gripped and turned quite sharply to beat the bat

gone! Yousuf falls! This time he tried to whip the ball away in the air with the turn, but succeeds only in giving Morgan an easy catch running in from the midwicket boundary. A good start from him, especially once he settled against Broad, but he's gone now
Shahzaib tries to nudge this round the corner, but the ball spins in and beats the bat to strike him on the pad. No lbw shout though, that was going well down leg
full and speared in on off stump, Alam looks to push the ball into space on the off side but can't get it away
beaten outside off! Alam was expecting turn where there was none as he tried to glance to third man
now there is some turn! Big turn in to the left-hander as Alam tries to make room. If Yardy's turning them there must be something in this pitch for the spinners!
much quicker and a touch shorter as well, Shahzaib is beaten on the pull and wears this one in the midriff
quick again, a touch fuller this time and again Shahzaib can't do anything with it
that's very quick indeed! A medium-pace delivery, really fired in from round the wicket and Shahzaib still can't get him away
full on off stump from round the wicket, Alam pushes into the covers and they set off straight away
cover drive, smashed just over a leaping fielder at extra cover. Bopara charges round on the ropes and cuts that off, good fielding
held back a touch by Swann, this really bites into the turf and spins away from Alam's bat sharply to beat the outside edge. It's definitely spinning people!
this time Alam stays deep in the crease and chops down behind square on the off side for one

Shahzaib goes, paying the price for impatience! He was looking increasingly frenetic at the crease, trying to hit everything too hard. This time he charged down the track, head in the air, and flailed at a flighted delivery from Swann. Unsurprisingly, he got nowhere near it, the ball spinning in sharply, and Davies has the bails off in a flash
that has ripped square! Pitching well wide of off, this would have spun far down the leg side had it not crashed into Umar's pad
speared in, this one doesn't turn but Alam isn't yet looking settled at the crease and doesn't really know where to hit this
slapped out to deep cover point for a couple
full on middle stump, nothing to be done with it though, another dot ball
much quicker through the air! But Yardy's also pulled this down a bit too short, and Alam slashes it away behind square on the off side for two more
appeal for lbw as Alam bends into an optimistic slog sweep and is struck on the body! Replays suggest it would have hit the top of middle, but struck him perhaps just outside off
chopped away for one
big spin again, looped up before ripping past the outside edge
edged, Alam closes the face and it skews off the outside edge to short third man
Alam has had an almighty fling at this and has lost his bat in the process. Really throwing the bat against it as it slides out of his hands
the time the sweep is completed with the bat still firmly in hands and a single is taken to deep backwards square
Alam getting very twitchy here, he pokes another to point and is desperate to get off strike but can't
swing and a miss! Alam is clueless poor fellow, huge mow from outside off stump but the ball bounces and spins well past the bat
runs, and four of them! Not a great delivery it must be said, very short and wide and Umar crashes a cut to the third man boundary
dropped! Tim Bresnan puts down a fairly simple chance, short from Collingwood, Umar launched into a pull shot that burst through Bresnan's hands at short midwicket and ended up crashing into his cap
played and missed this time, outside off, Umar is trying to smack the ball out of Wales, and misses
once again Umar tries to hit it too hard and loses his shape on a pull shot, trickles into the leg side for a single
dilscoop, in a way, not a great way, Alam down on one knee and trying to flap it over his head, doesn't connect very well but picks up a couple
cripes, Alam has not got close to timing a single shot this innings, this ends up being bunted down the ground off the toe end to keep the strike
decent shot this time from Alam, upper-cutting to point crisply for a couple
this is probably his best shot yet, waiting on the ball nicely before cutting to point
fuller from Swann, lovely bowling, Alam had committed to play off the back foot and could't connect because of the change of length
full once more, chipped down the ground for a single
wow, this spins a huge distance as well and Umar is completely cramped for room as he tries to cut
slightly quicker ball to finish, deflected into the leg side for a single to end a brilliant spell from Swann
slung in quickly towards the legs, turned round the corner neatly by Umar
much slower from Yardy, left Umar waiting and waiting on the back foot and he can't work it away
slightly shorter and Umar can't get enough room to cut
top shot and top fielding too, Umar got down on one knee early and flicked it over his head towards fine leg where Stuart Broad ran around, dived full length and pulled off an excellent save
this time Umar gets to cut, he's always looking for the shot, and connects well enough to find deep cover
quicker from Yardy to finish, it's on to Umar in a flash and he dabs towards square leg for a strike-stealing single
Umar runs well outside off stump and gets down on one knee to try and dink it to fine leg but Sidebottom follows him and Umar can't time the shot at all. Good bowling that
good slower ball this time, he's a canny operator, big swish from Alam but he never looked like connecting
excellent stuff from Sidebottom, not so good from Alam, so bad in fact that Razzak has his head in his hands in the dug out
this won't make Razzak any happier, poor old Alam has absolutely lost it, he ran down the wicket with his head in the clouds and tried to smash this miles, but missed by further
finally he connects, swinging a pull shot away, he looks surprised to find the bat on the ball
another short ball, slower too, Alam has to fetch it from high outside off stump and manages to get a single for the effort. Excellent over from Sidebottom

finally the torture is over, it's been a truly awful innings and England may be disappointed to see him go, shortish ball that he ends up chipping back off the leading edge to gift Yardy a wicket. Big roar from the crowd it's BoomBoom time!
no bluster from Afridi here, just stands tall and very correctly punches a cover drive through the off side
is this Bishan Bedi!? Yardy has ripped this off a length beating Umar's outside edge
quicker ball this time that Umar deflects into the leg side for a single
Afridi stands very still and clumps this towards the deep midwicket boundary for a couple

shot! Afridi jumps down the leg side to give him room and aims an expansive back-foot cover drive, really launching his arms at the ball but he times it well and the placement is excellent, beating the boundary riders
slower ball from Sidebottom, short as well, Umar has no pace to work with and ends up wheeling a pull shot for a single
fuller ball from Sidebottom that Afridi tries to smash down the ground, lots of movement from the batsman but no timing and only a single down the ground
Umar this time runs outside off to try and beat the keeper but Sidebottom follows him, excellent bowling
yorker this time, good one too, jabbed down the ground and it's only a single
big grunt from Sidebottom and it's helped him delivery another excellent delivery, giving Umar nothing to work with and it can only be pushed down the ground for a single
slower ball bouncer that Afridi has to wait an age to swat down the ground, again not timed at all, but it lands short of the man at the long-on boundary
dropped tough chance back to the bowler in his follow through, Afridi clattered a slog off the toe-end back to Broad and it just hit his hands
top fielding this! Luke Wright, bustling around the long-on boundary, dives and palms the ball back from the boundary edge after Afridi connected with an enormous mow
short and sharp from Broad, Afridi aimed another massive swish but missed
dropped! again, this time it was an easy chance, Afridi mistimed a slog down the ground and Luke Wright raced it and spilled the take
good shot by Umar this time, swatting it away for a couple
well timed here again from Umar, getting deep into his crease and cutting firmly down to deep point
Umar keeps trying the shot and can't quite pull it off, running outside off stump and trying to dink it round the corner, he connects well this time but picks out short fine leg
these slower-ball bouncers are demon, Afridi again mistimes an attempted pull, ending up with an ugly mow that trickles away for one
Umar at it again, and it's similarly ineffective, ends up dobbing it looping one-bounce to short fine leg
fuller ball, yorker length and this is actually timed very well down the ground for a single
shot! More conventional from Umar and it's paid dividends, skipping down the wicket and flicking to deep midwicket for a boundary, only the eighth of the innings
very short, too short for the umpires' liking and that is the first extra of the innings, good work England
single to finish the over, banged in short and it skews away for one
short ball that Umar manages to bully down the ground, some very good running from the captain means they get back for a second
just a single this time as Umar  times a cut shot well to deep cover
short again from Broad, into the body and cramping Afridi for room, he shoves  down the ground for a single
only a single here again, slugged away down the ground

excellent over from Broad, he's completely sure of what he's trying to do, short and into Afridi's body, no room to swing his big arms and it comes off his back and squirts into the off side for a single
couple to finish, Umar getting deep into his crease and heaving to deep midwicket to finish the innings
